DOC.brief_summary: The aim study evaluate effect dexmedetomidine infusion early stage renal function .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects Dexmedetomidine Early Stage Renal Functions Pediatric Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Contrast-induced nephropathy third common cause acute renal failure hospitalize patient age group . In study aim investigate effect dexmedetomidine early stage renal function pediatric patient undergoing cardiac angiography . Methods : 60 pediatric patient 6 72 month age undergoing cardiac angiography include study . Patients divide two group . The patient group administer 1mgkg-1 ketamine , 1mgkg-1 propofol bolus follow 1 mgkg-1hour-1 ketamine 50 µgkg-1min-1 propofol infusion . Additionally , load dose 1 µgkg-1 dexmedetomidine give 10 minute follow 0.5 µgkg-1hour-1 dexmedetomidine infusion patient group D. The patient evaluate NGAL , creatinine , renin , endothelin-1 , TAS TOS blood level procedure 6th 24th hour procedure . pRIFLE criterion use define CIN incidence study .
DOC.criteria: 6 72 month child schedule cardiac angiography patient renal failure diabetes mellitus , patient nephrotoxic vasoactive drug simultaneously , patient decompensated congestive heart failure patient administer contrast medium last two week
